turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: Negative copy on that, Pham, check your frequency.  I'm on forty-nine.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Burt, can you hear me now?

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: Just barely, Pham.  What are you all doing up on your roofs. What the hell's going on?  Come back.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Burt!  This is Val!  Get out of your basement!!  Take your radio! You and Heather get up on your roof!  Then we'll talk, okay?!

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: Val?  What the hell you doing back already?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Burt, get out!  Get up on your roof or someplace!  We found out what's been killing people!  They're under the ground!

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: What's under the ground?  We're not getting up on the roof.  Earth shelter's the best.  Known that since I was a kid.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Listen!  Listen!  We know what they are!  They're big things under the ground!  Much bigger than we thought!  They're coming after you! They're coming right now!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Let's go you two.  We're headed for the mountains.

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: In a minute.

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: That's fine.  We've got some new things to teach them.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Damn it!  They'll sink this rig just like a boat!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Jesus Christ, we're only going nine miles.  Be there in two hours, tops!

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: Yeah, well those things are gonna be on our ass every foot of the way, right?

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: She's got my vote.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Right.  We're gonna run.  Get ready.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: BACK OFF, BURT...!

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: Well, who put you two in charge?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Well, we'll ask around.  Let you know if we hear of anything.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Thanks.  God, I hope they're not screwed up.  I might have to bag the whole semester. Anyway, sorry to bother you.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: No problem.  Nice meeting you. Hope you get it sorted out.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Jesus Christ...think it smells like that 'cause it's dead?

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: I don't see any eyes...must be totally subterranean...and those tentacles...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I think they shoot right outta its mouth, hook you, and pull you right in.  Good thing we stopped it before it killed anybody else.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Yeah, I'm lucky it didn't find <u>me</u>.  This is important, you know.  This is like, well, let's say it, it's probably the biggest zoological discovery of the century.  The century?  Forget it.  <u>History</u>.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Well, at least the bastard can't climb.  Pardon my French.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Probably couldn't move too easily on the surface.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: There's nothing like them in the fossil record, I'm sure...Okay, so they predate the fossil record...  That'd make them a couple of billion years old...and we've just never seen one till now.  Right.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I'd vote for outer space.  No way those are local boys.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: I might have an idea...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: We're gonna have to come up with some kind of plan or it's just gonna wait us to death.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Well, I was wondering if we could...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I'll bet you're sorry the college ever sent you up here.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Well, I'm scared, but I'm not sorry.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You know, Val went to that college, too.  For a whole year.  Couldn't quite sit still for it, though. Had too much vinegar in his system. But once he settles down, forgets this cowboy stuff, he'll be one in a million.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You know, up the jeep trail.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: The mountains are solid granite. We'd be safe there, and we could hike along them...all the way to Bixby if we have to.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Well, we can take my truck then.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: No good.  You need major four- wheel-drive just to get up that jeep trail.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Oh my God.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Son of a bitchin' lowlife, putrid, scum...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: He'll never make it!  They're gonna get him!

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: VAL, STOP!  THEY'RE COMING!  DON'T MOVE!

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: We're not going over there, right?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: No.  We go straight.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: So...now what?

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Could we make it to the mountains?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Where the hell are they?  Hope they didn't wise up.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Nope, there!  That's one.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Hi, guys.  Burt loaned me his camera.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Howdy, Rhonda.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: You're really leaving, huh?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You bet.  You gonna be staying up here?

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Well, yeah!  There's going to be major research up here.  First thing is to get some pictures of that one we dug up.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You didn't cook breakfast?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Did it yesterday.  Franks and beans.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: No...it was eggs.  I did eggs.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Hell you did.  Your turn.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: How many cows does it take to make a stampede?  Is it like three or more?  Is there a minimum speed?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I was in one.  A bolt of lightning blew up cottonwood tree.  Three hundred head going hell-bent for the horizon.  Wasn't so damn funny, I can  tell you.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: If there was one nearby I'd probably ask him.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I keep thinking, if we were but half serious about money, we should quit being hired hands and...

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Handymen, Earl.  We're handymen.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Whatever the hell we are, we should quit and go get ourselves some real employment.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Goddamn jeep trail gets worse every year.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Has a lot of rain.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You're gonna get us hung up.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Do not talk to the driver.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Uh...Digging that waterhole for Nestor.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Burt and Heather's place is closer. Let's do their kitchen today.  Do Nestor tomorrow.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Nestor's out of town tomorrow.  We don't dig today.  We don't get paid today.  Damn it, Valentine, you never plan ahead.  You never take the long view.  Hell, here it is Monday and I'm already working on Wednesday.  It is Monday, right?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Who the hell's that?  That's not what's his name...the grad student?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Nah, it's September.  Must be the new one.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: The new one!  That's supposed to be a girl!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You know, if you wanted, we could take a look at those seismographs for her.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: What the hell do we know about seismographs?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Nothing.  But it sure might be a nice way of getting to know her.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Goddamnit, Valentine, you won't go for any gal unless she fits that damn list of yours A to Z...

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Well, sure.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: ...And is dumber than my hind end. Like that Bobby Lynn Dexter...

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Tammy Lynn Baxter.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Don't matter.  They're all the same: dead weight.  Can't make a decision, can't walk because of their shoes, can't work because of their fingernails.  Make my skin crawl!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Well, I'm a victim of circumstance.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I thought you called it your pecker.  Look, don't make the mistake I made.  Twenty years of looking for a woman exactly like Miss October 1968, and where'd it get me?  Here with you.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Catch it later, Pham.  Gotta get over to Nestor's.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Right.  We plan ahead.  That way we don't do anything right now.  Earl explained it to me.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Why don't his parents ever take him to Vegas with them?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You gotta ask <u>that</u>?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: So what if we just did it...today. Pack up.  Drive straight down to Bixby.  Get serious.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: We could.  We could.  But we'd have to get <u>really</u> serious.  It's gonna cost twice as much to rent a place.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: So?  That car wash pays good, and they're always looking.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Car wash?!  That's got no future. If we're gonna take the plunge we oughta have a better plan than that.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Yeah, sure.  Go ahead and plan it...for a year or two.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Well, <u>you're</u> the one won't work in the car wash.  You're the one's gotta have a plan.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Damn it, Val!  Not having a plan is what keeps us doing jobs like this!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: What keeps us doing jobs like this is you dragging your feet.  I was up for going to Bixby.  I was getting excited.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: In the past year I must've said a hundred times "We gotta get out of Perfection.  We gotta better ourselves."  You gonna stand there in broad daylight and tell me you think I'm the reason we're still here?  You want to know how close I am to going to Bixby right <u>now</u>?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: I'll call that little bluff.  How close?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Uh oh, it's Nancy.  She wants another load of firewood.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Forget it, man.  It's not worth it.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: She's got us.  Now, listen, the plan is: we have done our last job in Perfection.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: That's the plan.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: We did it!  We faced temptation and we did not bend!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Damn straight!  Now there's nothing between us and Bixby but nothing!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: So long, cactus!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Adios, bridge!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Jeez, look at that guy.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: One job I'd never take is working around electricity.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Especially when it's two hundred feet off the ground.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You're full of shit.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: He's only got one damn jacket. That's him, I'm telling you.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Reckon he hated Perfection more than us?  You suppose he <u>wanted</u> to kill himself?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: If he did, why didn't he use his damn shotgun?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Maybe he just couldn't pull the trigger...

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Oh sure, he figured it was easier to die of thirst?  Come on, sombody must've chased him up there.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Oh, you mean somebody who ain't scared of a twelve gauge shotgun. And then what did they do?  Camp out down below and just wait for him to die?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Well, whatever the hell happened it's just one more goddamn good reason to haul ass out of this place.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You got that right.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Probably up a pole starving itself to death.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Okay, the plan is: pedal to the metal the whole way.  We don't stop till we hit the carwash, not even to pee.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: I'll go with that plan.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Oh, Jesus!!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: What the hell is going on?  I mean WHAT THE <u>HELL</u> IS GOING ON?!!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Brother, we decided to leave this place just one day too late, you know?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Well, there's sure as hell nothing to stop us now.  Everybody we know between here and Bixby is already dead.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Those assholes are supposed to be <u>fixing</u> the goddamn road!  Hey!  Where are you guys?  People gotta use this road, you know! You on a booze break or what?!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Val!  Val!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Jesus!  I don't <u>believe</u> this!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You're hung up again.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: I am not!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Fuck you!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Hey, I don't want spend the night out here!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: It must've grabbed us.  That's why the truck stalled-out.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Yeah!  Next time I tell you I'm not hung up...!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Slick as snot and I'm not lying.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Fifteen lousy bucks.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: A man who plans ahead.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Pham, we don't want to be stuck on a couple of canners.  They better be fast.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Relax.  A snake thing like that couldn't move too quick.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Screw you.  For all you know they could <u>fly</u>.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You want the rifle or the Smith?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: The rifle.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: That means we're gonna be out here, like, in the dark.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Great.  Thank you.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Car's gone.  We just missed them, that's all.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Then where's the goddamn Conway Twitty coming from?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Here's the plan...We don't <u>even</u> stop.  Ride like hell.  Tonight we keep right on going.  We'll walk the horses.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: That <u>is</u> the plan...I mean, goddamn it!  What the hell are those things?  How could they bury an entire Plymouth station wagon?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: <u>Why</u> would they do it?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Shut up!  They got wind of something they don't like!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Oh shit!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: What the hell are they?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Sons of bitches!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: This is one big mother!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: So this is the guy that had your seismos working overtime?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Hey, Rhonda, you ever heard of <u>any</u>thing like this before?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Sure, Earl, everybody knows about them.  We just didn't tell <u>you</u>. Come on, nobody's ever seen one of these!  We're really <u>in</u> on something here!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Pham Van don't get his mitts on <u>this</u> for no measly fifteen bucks!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: You got <u>that</u> right!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Here's the plan: we'll get a...a flatbed, I guess, with a big winch, figure a five ton anyway.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Naw, don't want to winch it.  That'd tear it all up.  Want to lift it. Some kind of crane with lifting straps.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: We'll take your word for it.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Yeah.  Where's your truck?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Prairie dog burrow...

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Little sons of bitches.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: God, the live ones smell worse tan the dead ones.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Okay, now, how far's your truck?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: I don't know.  If this one's any faster than that other one...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I think we wait right here.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Well...haven't seen a sign for hours.  Maybe it's long gone.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Maybe it is.  Why don't you take a little stroll and see?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Fuck you, too.  Pardon my French.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Son of a bitch!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Son of a god<u>damned</u> bitch!  Been waiting there all this time.  How the hell's it even know we're still here?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: It's been listening to us.  It's got no eyes.  It sure as hell can't smell anything underground, so I figure...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You know, I hate to be crude, but I'm gonna have to take care of some business here.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Me, too.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Well, folks, what's the plan?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: First let's see if Stumpy's still out there.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Don't he have a home to go to?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Well, that's why Edgar never got down off that tower.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Run for it?  Running's not a plan. Running is what you do when the plan fails.  You're not even trying to come up with a plan!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Well, it's not like we've got a hell of a lot of options...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You go north, I'll go south.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You're right, don't matter where they come from.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Right.  We need to be talking about what we're gonna do.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I'm gonna kick his ass!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: I'm gonna help you.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Shut it up!  Shut the little bastard up!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Chuck him out the door!  Like a little hors d'oeuvre.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: How the hell long it take <u>you</u> to change a tire?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Just about too damn long.  Bolt pattern's probably wrong anyway.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: We need another plan.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Wait a minute...the Cat.  Could we take the Cat?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Jesus.  It's slower than hell.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Yeah, but it weighs better than thirty tons.  No way they could stop it.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: But...we could pull something!  We could, I don't know, drag a car behind it!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: A car, huh?  Like a big armored car?  Need something bigger, tougher...our truck maybe...or, hell, that old semi trailer!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Its tires are flat...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Doesn't matter.  The cat can pull <u>any</u>thing.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Well...all <u>right</u>!  We just roll on out of here!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: We got a plan!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: <u>I'm</u> making the run to the Cat.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Like hell you are.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Get real.  I'm faster than you.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: <u>I'm</u> best at driving the Cat.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Only if something happens to me.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Watch your ass, shithead.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Don't worry about me, jerkoff.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Damn it.  What the hell are they doing?  They're up to something.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I don't care what they're doing as long as they're doing it way over there.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Come on, everybody!  We gotta run for those rocks over there!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Jesus, Val, it's pretty far.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Well...that's it.  We're not getting off this rock...

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Not going to pole vault anywhere. That's for sure.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Come on, you're not going to do your lasso thing...?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Hey, just 'cause you're no good with a rope...

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: They're...they're trying to make us move!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Or just knock us over.  Look, use the bomb!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: It's out last one.  We can't kill them all.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Use the fucking bomb!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: So, we get back on that rock and in three days we're dead anyway.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I want to live for the three days.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: What the hell are you doing?!!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: I GOT A GODDAMN PLAN!!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Light it, man!  LIGHT IT!!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Not yet, not yet...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Road's in!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Road's in!  Now, soon as we hit Bixby we start making phone calls. We could make some real money off this whole thing, get in <u>People</u> magazine...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: <u>People</u>?  Hell, <u>National</u> <u>Geographic</u>.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Sell the movie rights.  We're going straight from blue-collar to white -collar.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Yeah...but no ties.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: No ties.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Christ, Val, maybe she's not your type, but you could, at least, be civil.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Civil?  I'm civil.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You're not civil, you're glum.  We got the world by the tail with a downhill pull and all of a sudden you go glum on me.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Somebody paying you to do this?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: She just practically asked you for a date.  What the hell is wrong?!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Fine, make the mistakes I did. I think I'll just be playing this hand myself.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: She likes <u>both</u> of us.  We both helped her out.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: You are so full of shit...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Oh yeah?  Think about this:  She ain't as narrow-minded as you. I'll lay odds she's looking for character in a man.  For my part, I'd be proud to have her.  I'd goddamn worship her.

turns.speaker: OLD FRED
turns.text: How's she doing?

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: She wants to lay down.  I'm a little worried.

turns.speaker: OLD FRED
turns.text: Well, I brung her something I know she likes.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: Damn, Fred, you can't give away all those.

turns.speaker: OLD FRED
turns.text: Forget it.  I got vegetables coming out my ears.  Usually the varmints eat up half my crop, but lately I ain't so much as <u>seen</u> a gopher or a jack-rabbit nowheres.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: If that ain't the truth.  And I count on them for a little bit of stew meat...Thank you, Fred.

turns.speaker: OLD FRED
turns.text: We playing cards tonight?

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: I think I'm gonna be sitting up with her.

turns.speaker: OLD FRED
turns.text: I'd do the same.  Well, catch you Thursday.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: You bet.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Hi, guys, what you been up to?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Ran into the new college student, Rona.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Down, honey, down.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Yeah, Burt.  The way you worry, you're gonna have a heart attack before you get to survive World War III.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Burt!  Heather!

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Yeah, Val.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: We're in deep shit over here. Let's change that plan.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: We're here, Val.  Just tell us what you need.  Come back.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: They're tearing down the houses here!  We all gotta get outta here together!  Now!
